Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactIn, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactIn) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.find_contact(keyword: str, skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts with entered keyword for a specified user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactIn) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The list of contacts with the specified keyword.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_birthday_for_next_seven_days(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters, which have birthdays within the next seven days.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

List of contacts who have a birthday in the next seven days, in ascending order by ‘birthday’.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(username: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirmes an email of the user.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing is returned. The function performs updates to the database.

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserIn, db: Session) → UserOut¶

Creates a new user for a specific data.

Parameters:

  • body (UserIn) – The data for the user to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

UserOut

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_username(username: str, db: Session) → UserOut¶

Retrieves a user data for a specific username.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username of the user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Data of the user found via username.

Return type:

UserOut

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(username, url: str, db: Session) → UserOut¶

Updates the avatar of the user with new one.

Parameters:

  • username (str) – Username of the user.

  • url (str) – Address URL of the new avatar.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user data with new avatar.

Return type:

UserOut

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The data of the user.

  • token (str | None) – Genereted a new token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing is returned. The function performs updates to the database.

Return type:

None
